intro: Nephelea sternbergii f. sampaioana, commonly known as the Sampaio's nephelea, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, velvety leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
